item.title: Tekken 8 Bot Gets to Destroyer Rank Pressing One Button
item.description:
Highlights

  • A Twitch streamer created a Tekken 8 Eddy Gordo bot that reached Destroyer rank by spamming one button.
  • Spammers in Tekken 8 are notorious for repetitive moves, and even top ranks may fall victim.

A fan-made Tekken 8 bot managed to obtain an online rank of Destroyer by pressing a single button. Bandai Namco's 3D fighter franchise has fostered a sizable and dedicated community since its 1994 debut, but that doesn't mean all the members of the Tekken sphere can agree on acceptable playstyles. Many players particularly look down on "spammers," but as one user's Tekken 8 bot has shown, there might be a reason why mashing the same move over and over again is such a popular strategy.

Spammers are players who mash a single button or repeatedly perform the same move string during a match, typically with very little deviation in their attack patterns. Tekken 's Eddy Gordo, who made his debut in Tekken 3 , has long been regarded as one of the fighters most prone to attracting spammers, not only for his unorthodox moves but also because his evasive and graceful capoeira style is difficult to predict even for veterans familiar with the Tekken franchise . While there are plenty of longtime fans who can vouch for the character's complexity, Eddy players — especially those in the lower ranks — have garnered an infamous reputation for winning matches by relentlessly spamming, which has since become one of the inside jokes of the community.

2:22
Related
Tekken 8 Reveals Free Update Roadmap and Second DLC Character
Tekken 8 reveals the second DLC character as well as a free content roadmap which aims to bring new stages, game modes, and much more.

One user attempted to verify how a player spamming several of Eddy's powerful combo strings might fair in Tekken 8 's online ranked mode. Twitch streamer jimmashima used a bot programmed to press one, and only one, button without regard for spacing, frame data, or character matchup and set it loose on the game's matchmaking system. The bot surprisingly had a decent run, even making its way to the game's orange ranks and peaking at Destroyer — only two steps away from Garyu and Tekken 8 's red ranks.

Tekken 8 Ranking System Explained

For context, Tekken 8 's online matchmaking is divided into color divisions, ranging from brown to gold, with three separate ranks in every division. If a new player attempted to climb the ladder from the very bottom, the orange ranks would be the sixth division they would enter. While players around this level are still considered beginners, orange and all the divisions below comprise a sizable chunk of the player base. Previous match statistics gathered from Tekken 8 's replay system indicated that reaching orange placed a player roughly on or above the level of over half of the game's entire ranked population.

Eddy's return brought about major developments and controversies to the Tekken 8 community, partly because he was the first DLC character for this iteration of the franchise and partly due to several gameplay and monetization changes introduced alongside the update. Regardless, series veterans likely found some amusement in the fact that even in Tekken 8 , complaining about Eddy spammers remained a community pastime.

item.title: Xbox Game Pass Losing 6 Games Today
item.description:
Highlights

  • Xbox Game Pass is losing six games on April 30.
  • The list of imminent departures includes 7 Days to Die and Besiege.
  • Following this catalog rotation, Xbox Game Pass will have lost 12 titles in April 2024, while adding 17 others.

Ravenlok and five other games are leaving Xbox Game Pass later today, April 30. This wave of outgoing titles will round off an uncharacteristically busy month for Xbox Game Pass in terms of departures.

The popular subscription service removes games from its library twice a month, i.e., once every two weeks. Such catalog updates commonly compromise two or three outgoing titles. But this month marked a deviation from that pattern, with Xbox Game Pass already losing six games on April 15 , with another half a dozen being set to depart later today.

2:15
Related
PC Game Pass Adds the Most Wishlisted Game on Steam
Xbox Game Pass Ultimate adds a highly anticipated day-one game that has been wishlisted by over 3 million Steam users ahead of its debut.

And while the mid-April departures were primarily a sad day for the Xbox Game Pass horror library , this newest wave of outgoings spans a much more varied mixture of genres. Specifically, Microsoft's subscription service is now about to lose 7 Days to Die , Besiege , EA Sports NHL 22 , Loot River , Pikuniku , and Ravenlok . EA's hockey sim is the sole console-only title from the latest list of departures, as well as the only one that was exclusively available to Xbox Game Pass Ultimate subscribers. The other five have been offered across all tiers of the service bar Xbox Game Pass Core.

Xbox Game Pass Games Leaving April 30

Game

Genre

Added

Platforms

How Long To Beat

7 Days to Die

Survival Horror

April 2022

Cloud, Console, PC

54–450 hours

EA Sports NHL 22

May 2022

60–156 hours

Loot River

4–10 hours

Pikuniku

Puzzle Adventure

March 2020

Cloud, Console, PC

3–6 hours

Ravenlok

ARPG

May 2023

Cloud, Console, PC

4–5 hours

Xbox Game Pass members looking to make the most of their subscriptions may still be able to beat at least one of these titles before they leave the service, even if they haven't started it yet. Going by How Long To Beat's crowdsourced data, Sectordub and Devolver Digital's Pikuniku is the briefest experience of the lot, being beatable in as little as three hours. Though it's also the game that long-time subscribers had the longest opportunity to beat from this wave of departures, having debuted on Xbox Game Pass back in March 2020.

Beyond that, roguelike Loot River and action RPG Ravenlok are also beatable in just a handful of hours. The latter may be a more compelling proposition for last-minute achievement hunters, as its completionist runs tend to be much shorter. The April 30 Xbox Game Pass departures also include Besiege , a medieval city builder that can be largely experienced in a single day, although its sandbox nature makes it a bit more difficult to define what actually constitutes beating it.

While this is the second time in two weeks that Xbox Game Pass is about to lose half a dozen titles, this month has still been a net positive for the service; following the April 30 arrival of Have a Nice Death on Xbox Game Pass , Microsoft's game catalog has added 17 titles since the turn of the month.

item.title: Xbox Game Pass Adds a Funny, Stylish Game With Great Reviews
item.description:
Highlights

  • Have a Nice Death is now available on Xbox Game Pass.
  • The celebrated roguelike is the 17th title to reach Xbox Game Pass in April 2024.

The Xbox Game Pass library has expanded to include Have a Nice Death . The stylish and scintillating roguelike is the 17th new title to reach Xbox Game Pass in April 2024.

Have a Nice Death is the second-ever game from Montpellier, France-based Magic Design Studios. It debuted to critical acclaim in March 2023, with many reviewers praising Have a Nice Death for its addictive gameplay loop, satirical themes, and fast-paced combat. A year into its release, this distinct-looking roguelike boasts over 8,000 "Very Positive" Steam reviews, as well as a Metacritic Metascore ranging between 77 and 81, depending on the platform.

Related
New Xbox Game Pass Game Coming July 18 Might Appeal to Zelda Fans
July 18 will see Xbox Game Pass add a day-one title that combines elements of Persona and Zelda with some absolutely stunning scenery.

Publisher Arc Games has now brought Have a Nice Death to Microsoft's subscription service, where it debuted on April 30. As is normally the case, this release was communicated well in advance, with Microsoft's confirming the game's arrival as part of its Xbox Game Pass April 2024 Wave 2 lineup announcement . Have a Nice Death is now available across all non-Core tiers of the service, and can be played on both PC and the last two generations of Xbox consoles. It also comes with 37 achievements worth 1,000 Gamerscore points in total.

This release further extends the already vast collection of excellent roguelike games on Xbox Game Pass . And while Have a Nice Death has been widely touted as a stellar example of its genre, that's not only on account of its gameplay qualities and high replay value. Instead, what makes this title truly memorable is its premise, which places players in the shoes of Death Incorporated CEO, Mr. Grim Reaper himself. The game starts with Death being buried in a mountain of paperwork caused by his minions, Sorrows, becoming a bit too enthusiastic in their efforts to make souls on Earth kick the bucket.

Each Sorrow represents a type of death, ranging from addiction and natural disasters to illness and war. The Sorrows act as Have a Nice Death 's major bosses, with all of them having their own unique environments and serving as personified, poignant commentary on life. The overall experience plays similarly to Dead Cells , not least because of its fast-paced roguelike loop centered around conquering procedurally generated levels in between boss fights.

Have a Nice Death rounds off another release-packed month for Microsoft's subscription service, which saw it add 17 titles to its content library. The first wave of Xbox Game Pass games for May 2024 is expected to be announced in the coming days.

item.title: Palia Releases Brand-New Hotfix Update
item.description:
Highlights

  • Jump back into Palia after Hotfix 0.179.1 fixed crashes when fishing, crafting, or visiting Phoenix Falls.
  • Fixes in the update prevent freezes when re-gifting to increase bonds with villagers.
  • The previous patch, 0.179, introduced new content like Courtyard building and new flower types.

Hotfix 0.179.1 for Palia has just dropped, delivering a number of fixes for issues that have been causing game crashes and freezes. This follows the recent release of a patch for the MMO that introduced new content, features, and quality-of-life improvements.

Palia is an Unreal Engine-powered community simulation game set in an original high fantasy world that is being developed and published by Singularity 6, a studio based in Los Angeles. The game, which is still in open beta, received a Switch version in December, and it was added to Steam not long after in late March. Since becoming available on Valve's game distribution platform, Palia has received quite a few updates, with the latest one addressing several problems.

Related
Palia: How To Make Money (Gold)
New Palia players may struggle to find the best ways to make money. Here's how to make it easy.

The 0.179.1 Hotfix for Palia went live on April 29, fixing issues that sometimes caused crashes for players who tried to fish, craft, or visit the Temple of the Waves in Phoenix Falls. This update also fixed issues that resulted in freezes when attempting to re-gift villagers. Providing gifts to villagers in Palia is an important aspect of the game's friendship and romance system, as it increases their bond levels with a player.

Singularity 6's latest update dropped just a few days after the release of Patch 0.179 for Palia . Aside from delivering improvements and adjustments to the game, the previous update, which went live on April 23, added a lot of new content to the game. It introduced Courtyard building, several new flower types, Cyl the Green Plush, the Ammo Pouch item, more than 50 achievements for Palia 's Steam version, and three new outfit bundles in the Premium Store.

Patch 0.179 also added Level 5 Quests for the NPCs Zeki, Ashura, Tish, and Reth. The latter three are considered to be some of the best villagers to befriend in Palia due to the rewards they give out. Ashura, the local innkeeper, provides new tools and construction upgrades. Becoming Tish's friend, meanwhile, unlocks new furniture items and decorations. As for Reth, raising his bond levels will reward players with food recipes and cooking appliances.

Among the types of additional content players have been asking for are new areas and new creatures in Palia . Currently, there are only two major areas in the game, Kilima Valley and Bahari Bay. Meanwhile, the game's world is inhabited by just nine types of creatures, with the latest addition, the wolf-life Mujin, being introduced last November in Palia 's 0.173 Build.

Palia Hotfix 0.179.1 Patch Notes

The following issues have been fixed:

  • Fixed an issue that caused crashing when at the Temple of the Waves (by Phoenix Falls)
  • Fixed an issue where players may occasionally crash while fishing
  • Fixed an issue that caused certain types of crashing while on the housing plot
  • Fixed an issue that caused freezes occasionally when attempting to re-gift villagers
  • Fixed an issue that caused crashing occasionally when attempting to use crafters
  • Fixed a crashing issue relating to the multi-craft feature

item.title: New Co-Op Game Coming to Xbox Game Pass in 2024
item.description:
Highlights

  • All You Need Is Help, a new co-op puzzle game, will soon be on Xbox Game Pass for players who enjoy playing with friends.
  • The game, featuring cube-shaped creatures, arrives in Fall 2024 and launches day one on Xbox Game Pass.
  • Developer Q-Games, known for the PixelJunk franchise, brings past co-op experience to All You Need Is Help, promising a fun gameplay experience.

Xbox players may soon have their puzzle game appetite satiated as a recently announced title, All You Need Is Help , is set to land on Xbox Game Pass soon as a day-one launch title. Being a co-op game, All You Need Is Help will also cater to those Xbox Game Pass users who want to play with their friends.

The co-op multiplayer genre is quite popular among those who want to bond with family and friends over game sessions. Some games in this category have levels specifically designed to reward coordination among the players. Fortunately for Xbox fans, there is a plethora of co-op games available on Game Pass , and a brand-new title is set to join this long list this year.

Related
What Does 'Xbox Tax' Mean
Upon the reveal of the 2023 Game Awards’ Game of the Year nominees, Xbox fans weren't happy with a notable exclusive being left out.

During the ID@Xbox April 2024 event, developer Q-Games showcased the trailer for its new co-op puzzle game, All You Need Is Help . The reveal showed some gameplay footage that gave a glimpse into the cube-shaped player objects in the game. Moreover, it was confirmed that the puzzle title will arrive in Fall 2024 on PC, PS5, PS4, Xbox Series X|S, Xbox One, and Switch. Additionally, since it's a Game Pass day-one release, All You Need Is Help will hit Game Pass as soon as it launches.

As per the game's description on its Xbox page, All You Need Is Help is a "quirky" co-op multiplayer title where the players control cubic creatures to clear levels and progress further. The game features various obstacles and a control scheme that requires collaboration among the players. All You Need Is Help 's co-op supports up to four players and offers both offline and online multiplayer modes.

All You Need Is Help Developer Comes with Some Past Experience

Q-Games has been around since 2006 and has previous experience in the co-op genre, as well as in games containing puzzle-like elements. Furthermore, the studio is the developer behind the PixelJunk franchise, which includes games such as PixelJunk Raiders , PixelJunk Monsters , PixelJunk Shooter , and several more.

Most recently, Q-Games shipped a new version of 2016's The Tomorrow Children , titled The Tomorrow Children: Phoenix Edition , in 2022. This was yet another game that supported co-op gameplay and featured level design that encouraged players to collaborate in order to advance. The developer's previous experience with both puzzle and co-op games is promising for All You Need Is Help, and many gamers already have their expectations high as they wait for the next title from Q-Games to launch.
